Articles.Content:
The Kerbin Cross-Continental Rally (KCCR)

This is part of the Official Kerbal Racing Season rover race event, organized by myself and @Oliverm001x

 

The KCCR is an off-road cross-continental rally consisting of 8 stages. The race starts off at the Stage 1 flag (next to the KSC runway), and heads north along the continent towards the finish flag. The 8 stages offer every type of terrain, from smooth ground to rocky mountains and sheer cliffs for the racer to navigate on and around.

Each stage is roughly 60km, not too short and not too long.

THE DURATION OF THIS CHALLENGE IS FROM 1ST JANUARY TO 28TH FEBRUARY. AFTER THAT A NEW RALLY/RACE WILL BE HELD.

Save file for the rally: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/51esn08h184rtrh/AADEj35YVyqXYjqQT7YdDRf5a?dl=0


Screenshots (behold my amazing MS Paint skills! ) :

Full track

 

Stages 1-3 (Stage 1 starts at the KSC runway)

 

Stages 3-4

 

Stages 4-5

 

Stages 5-6

 

Stages 6-8

 

Rules:

 

  1. Main categories are Modded and Stock, subcategories are Electric only (E), Fuel/Electric (F/E), Fuel only (F) and Hovercraft (H).

  2. Only one vehicle is allowed for the entire rally, the vehicle cannot be replaced. However, fixing the vehicle (things like repairing wheels) is allowed. Using KIS/KAS to replace parts of the vehicle is allowed, but will put you in the modded section.

  3. Chutes are allowed.

  4. Flying is not allowed.

    1. Jumping, however, is allowed. A jump is classified as a jump if the craft is in the air but is not being propelled by anything. It should follow a (rough) arc and hit the ground again. If the throttle is active while the craft is in the air (resulting in the engines, if any, producing thrust), this is considered flying.

      1. Boost flaps are allowed. These block the thrust of engines instantly, avoiding the dreaded spool-up and spool-down times of jet engines. Junos are the only jet engines this method can be used on effectively.

      2. If boost flaps are not being used, then cutting throttle (using the X key) when the craft is in the air is sufficient. Even though the jet engines will still be producing thrust due to their long spool-down time, this can be disregarded as there is really no way to get around this.

  5. The method for submitting an entry is as follows:

    1. A screenshot of the vehicle inside the SPH/VAB.

    2. A screenshot of the vehicle no more than 10 meters from the stage start flag, with a speed of 0.0 m/s.

    3. A screenshot of the vehicle no more than 10 meters from the stage finish flag, with a speed of 0.0 m/s.

    4. Screenshots while driving the stage are welcome.

    5. Videos are highly encouraged, but the screenshots listed above are the bare minimum.

  6. A suggested way of keeping track of your time for each stage:

    1. When you start the stage, make a note of the mission clock (at the top-left of the screen), for example 01 mins 00 secs.

    2. When you finish the stage, make a note of the mission clock again, for example 15 mins 57 secs.

    3. And then do the maths: the start time subtracted from the finish time. In this example, the stage was started at 01 mins 00 secs, and finished at 15 mins 57 secs. 15:57 - 01:00 = 14 mins 57 secs, and that’s your time.

  7. You will be placed on the leaderboards according to your total time from each stage. Obviously, a lower time is better.

This is part of the Official KSP Racing Season, so any participants will get points, contributing to their season finish position (kind of how the F1 driver championship works). It's a WIP, check out that thread for more info.

 

Good luck!  

 

Please tell me if I missed anything, I'm sure I did.  

Edited January 6, 2017 by TheEpicSquared
Not sure why the pictures are stretched on the phone... I'll try to fix it tomorrow

Just now, TheEpicSquared said:

Not sure why the pictures are stretched on the phone... I'll try to fix it tomorrow  

They are fine on the computer

Just now, Oliverm001x said:

They are fine on the computer

Well that's good
Can't wait to enter

35 minutes ago, PixelStory2 said:

Can't wait to enter

Looking forward to your entry!

A few questions:

1. What is a hovercraft?

2. Must you take a direct route to each marker or can you route around some mountains? 

3. Are parachutes allowed? It's not flying but would aid in soft landings when going over cliffs.

4. Can we submit separate stages at a time? As in say I finish stage one and two today, but don't have time for any more could I just submit those, then finish later?

Welp, rip Attempt #1  Died on the descent of the snowy mountains.

Here's pic #1 

Pic #2 (Damaged front of car in first stage :P) 

Pic #3 (When you have a slow computer like me, you don't get fancy things like seeing where you're going.) 

Pic #4 (...) 

 

I also was running low on fuel around when I crashed. I would have made it to the next stage but I didn't know how to refuel, so I was screwed either way xD.

Gonna try again Tomorrow.

Edited January 1, 2017 by PixelStory2

@Baybrawler

1. Someone wanted to use the anti-gravity pads from the Kerbal Foundries mod to make a craft. I wasn't sure which category to put it in, so I just called it hovercraft.

2. The route you take is up to you, but make sure to keep track of your time.

3. Chutes are allowed. I'll add it to the rules.

4. You can submit stages separately, they don't all have to be submitted at the same time. But all stages need to be in by February 28th at the latest, as that's how long this challenge goes on for.

Hope that helps.
The results and official leader board will be posted on the Official KSP Racing Season page, where points will be up.

22 minutes ago, Oliverm001x said:

The results and official leader board will be posted on the Official KSP Racing Season page, where points will be up.

I'll put them here as well.

I'll be up for this, I'll be using anything i develop from the Dakar Kerbin edition, of which I'm just doing a second run, the first being a little lackluster .   So I'll take at least two slots in the modded category, the mods used will be chassis and wheels and deco items,  so far there's an EC version with fuel cells, and an EC with jet assist version both very different in mass and setup.

Spoiler

That is one damn sweet-looking rover!  

I'll be eagerly awaiting your entry!

5 minutes ago, TheEpicSquared said:

That is one damn sweet-looking rover!  

Cheers but..

Sadly Dakar experience has shown that being pretty is not an asset,  being tough as old boots and functional is all that matters at the end of the day , under certain conditions it's a fantastic truck but under others, like short sharp rippled terrain it get very unfriendly indeed, something I'll be remedying before I make my attempt with that one, but should the other finish the Dakar in one piece it's ready to go now

Spoiler

9 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

Sadly Dakar experience has shown that being pretty is not an asset,  being tough as old boots and functional is all that matters at the end of the day

Sadly I have to agree with you, funny thing is in the real Dakar it's the same thing: Some people enter for the experience and some people enter for the win...

I wish we could have a good old stock build rally, all equal, but who would enter that.... mods, mods, mods....

KSP challenges, It's like trying to organize a sports event without doping

Well cool beans. I'm game!

I was beginning to think I probably wouldn't like hosting one myself. Now I don't have to . I've got a spicy little number I'd like to try out on just this type of terrain  .

5 minutes ago, Triop said:

but who would enter that..

Hey, It's not for me ( i started playing KSP only because it was  amazingly moddable and a game I'd previously modded was dying)  but the challenge section has plenty of stock only challenges, so I'd imagine there's be a lot of takers, 

In KSP i don't believe there is ever an equal given the same stack of parts everybody arrives at the end with something very different and depending on skill level you have 256 parts engineering masterpieces or ten part Flintstones trucks  and that imo is a very uneven playing field and no more uneven than allowing mods to enter a challenge in an appropriate class.

There really hasn't been anything like the Dakar series and the OKRS in which mods could be fully tested, you can tool around KSC all week and not find out the stuff i found in two days of Dakar stage testing, for making durable well performing wheels it seems the only way to go, I'd like to think that if a squad type dared venture a stock entry then they'd be sorting some decent wheels and fixing the existing sets on return to dev land

6 minutes ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

There really hasn't been anything like the Dakar series and the OKRS in which mods could be fully tested, you can tool around KSC all week and not find out the stuff i found in two days of Dakar stage testing, for making durable well performing wheels it seems the only way to go, I'd like to think that if a squad type dared venture a stock entry then they'd be sorting some decent wheels and fixing the existing sets on return to dev land

I could not agree more.

 

I don't hate mods/tweaking, it's just making it hard to organize a straight up challenge.

Ok, I'm in.

Allmost stage 1:

The track looks like a great challenge, but I still don't like the timing you guys put this challenge up.

 

I will explain you why and it may sound stupid:

I love the Dakar, the real experience.

It starts at the first day of every new year, tradition.

You starting a same sort of rally right now is like https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/sacrilegious to me.

But I do understand that it inspired people to put up new rallys and I have to admit I encourage that since all I want to do is burn track.

 

No hard feelings dudes, I just ventilated and am ready to race.

There is room for all of us, Peace

 

*drops mic

I agree with @Triop ... your timing for posting this challenge is abysmal

I for one say boycott

Okay, I have finished stage 1.

Car:

 

It is an electric/fuel hybrid powered by four ruggedized wheels with four landing gear backups, and two Junos.

MET: 25s.

 

MET: 15:51. Total time: 15:26.

14 hours ago, Triop said:

I wish we could have a good old stock build rally, all equal, but who would enter that.... mods, mods, mods....

I would totally be up for that. When it comes to space I much prefer mods, but for challenges I am a believer in a fully-stock experience; puts everyone on the same, controlled footing.

I agree with @Triop ... your timing for posting this challenge is abysmal

I for one say boycott 

I wouldn't go that far, but I definitely agree that the timing shows a lack of patience.

Anyway, I'll join up after I finish up my competition Dakar run. Planning to use my solar-electric Dakar vehicle for this one as well.
